nodes.bodyText:
IMO amount of leading whitespaces shouldn't matter.
Is it possible to send this from the lexer itself, as a token?

why do we need this while loop?
is it possible to avoid getLexeme().endsWith(LexerTerminals.DEPRECATED) check? Coz regex-related operations on top of java Strings (such as contains(), endsWith(), startsWith(), etc ) can be really expensive..

Fixed with 2331d55. Thanks for pointing out expensive operation. :)
Reason for the while loop:
By code line 1648, lexer knows there's a WS # WS Deprecated match ahead. After calling processLeadingTrivia() lexer doesn't know, for how many chars, the reader should be advanced.
what about the newlines? don't we need to add it to the trailing trivia?

New line is already included in the documentation string.
e.g.
#  line1
function foo() { }

documentation string would be "# line1\n"
Then in the documentation lexer it will be parsed as the trailing trivia of whatever the last token.

What does this method do? is it flattening the doc-lists?
Can we do it right after getting the results from parseDocumentationString()? Then you don't have to traverse through the outer-list for a second time.

yea flattening.
yes we can. will add that fix.
we can define this as a class-level final static variable, since its a constant.
